solution_line_template: A triangle with a height of {triangle_height} inches and width of {triangle_width} inches has an area of {triangle_area} square inches because {triangle_area_factor} x {triangle_height} x {triangle_width} = <<{triangle_area_factor}*{triangle_height}*{triangle_width}={triangle_area}>>{triangle_area}
The square has an area of {square_area} square inches because {square_side} x {square_side} = <<{square_side}*{square_side}={square_area}>>{square_area}
